message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.LG, cs.DM

This paper deals with the problem of sorting with comparison errors, which is a fundamental problem in computer science and falls under the category of data structures (cs.DS). The paper also uses techniques from information theory (cs.IT) to analyze the error probability and from computational complexity (cs.CC) to prove lower bounds. Additionally, the paper presents a new algorithm that achieves optimal results, which could be of interest to the machine learning community (cs.LG) for applications such as ranking and recommendation systems. Finally, the paper involves solving sub-problems related to sorting, which could be relevant to the field of discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
